TopicTitle: SU-25 Frogfoot Attack Jet Exact Replica(96 parts)

Articles.Content: Ladies and gentlemen, I present you: **SU-25 Frogfoot** ![oJONNNI.png](http://i.imgur.com/oJONNNI.png) ![LX8x2Ba.png](http://i.imgur.com/LX8x2Ba.png) ![rIU0Q18.png](http://i.imgur.com/rIU0Q18.png) This beauty is based on the real life SU-25 attack jet. The replica handles extremely well, takes off flawlessly, easily pulls 10G maneuvers, comes with flaps and airbrakes, as well as a drogue chute for landings. Unlike the A-10 Warthog, it can go supersonic. Also comes with a great cockpit and some ladders. Enjoy! ![ueLCOQl.png](http://i.imgur.com/ueLCOQl.png) Full album: > [Javascript is disabled. View full album](//imgur.com/a/xY5IB) Dimensions are less than 1 m different from the real thing's dimensions. **KSP version specs:** Mass: **14.9 t** Height: **4.8 m** Width: 15.7 m Length: 16.7 m **Real life SU-25:** - Length**:** 15.53 m[^\[nb 1\]^](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Sukhoi_Su-25#cite_note-113) (50 ft 11^1^Ã¢Ââ€ž2 in) - [Wingspan](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Wingspan): 14.36 m (47 ft 1^1^Ã¢Ââ€ž2 in) - Height: **4.80 m** (15 ft 9 in) - Loaded weight: **14,600 kg** (32,187 lb) (normal take-off weight) - [Max. takeoff weight](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Maximum_takeoff_weight): 17,600 kg (38,800 lb) [Download Su-25 Frogfoot](http://kerbalx.com/SpaceXray/Su-25-Frogfoot.craft) Property of Zokesia Skunkworks - - - Updated - - - Real SU-25 for comparison: ![084_enl.jpg](http://hobby-games.com.ua/shop/published/publicdata/HOBBYGAME8636/attachments/SC/products_pictures/084_enl.jpg) ![su25t-1.gif](http://www.airwar.ru/image/idop/attack/su25t/su25t-1.gif) **Edited June 15, 2015 by SpaceXray**
Great job, I don't see many replicas with lines that smooth.

> 
> Great job, I don't see many replicas with lines that smooth.

Thanks! Also, update soon with weapons.
One problem, your engines are a bit to powerful for the design, should have used the less powerful jet engines. It would still go supersonic. Love the design though.
This thing rocks. I lost control (My fault) in the mountains, hit the left wing, tore almost all of it off, and it still landed and got the Kerbal back safely.

> 
> This thing rocks. I lost control (My fault) in the mountains, hit the left wing, tore almost all of it off, and it still landed and got the Kerbal back safely.

Haha yeah, you can still land it without an engine or without landing gear, it is pretty robust.

Yeah, the KSP engines are OP, but I like them they way they are. You can change the engines easily if you like.
